name: Pranay Aryal's biostatistics site
body:
### Final Exam Study Guide

Confidence Intervals
A confidence interval is two points (the lower and upper limits) between which the unknown
population quantity being estimated lies with a certain probability.
Heuristic Formula
𝑷𝒐𝒊𝒏𝒕 𝑬𝒔𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒂𝒕𝒆 ± (𝑫𝒊𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒃𝒖𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝑷𝒆𝒓𝒄𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒍𝒆) × (𝑺𝒕𝒂𝒏𝒅𝒂𝒓𝒅 𝑬𝒓𝒓𝒐𝒓)
- Each of the quantities – the point estimate, the percentile, and the standard error – depends on what is being estimated.       Consult the formulas on the following pages to see how.
- The percentile additionally depends on the level of confidence, (e.g.) 90%, 95%, 99%, etc.
- Remember that this heuristic formula does not apply for confidence intervals for variances and
ratios of variances.
